events.title: Ratification of the United States Bill of Rights
events.description: The first ten amendments to the United States Constitution, known as the Bill of Rights, were ratified, guaranteeing fundamental rights and freedoms to American citizens.
events.significance: Established core civil liberties and checks on government power that shape US law and society.

events.title: Battle of Nanchang begins
events.description: During the Second Sino-Japanese War, Chinese and Japanese forces fought the Battle of Nanchang, marking the first major Chinese offensive against the invading Japanese.
events.significance: Demonstrated Chinese resistance and strategic counterattacks during the war.

events.title: UN General Assembly adopts Resolution 1721
events.description: The United Nations General Assembly passed a resolution addressing issues relating to the establishment and recognition of decolonization and self-determination.
events.significance: Supported global movements for independence and self-determination during decolonization period.

events.title: The Jackson 5 release 'I Want You Back' single
events.description: The popular Motown group The Jackson 5 released their debut single, which became a number one hit and launched their successful career.
events.significance: Signaled the rise of one of the most influential musical acts, impacting pop and soul music.

events.title: The Leaning Tower of Pisa reopened
events.description: After 11 years of restoration efforts to stabilize the structure, the Leaning Tower of Pisa was reopened to the public.
events.significance: Preserved a famous architectural landmark and tourist attraction, symbolizing engineering achievement and cultural history.
